description: This is the simplest way to make a quick puff pastry, but if time is short use shop-bought instead.
name: Easy Cheesy Straws Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Freeze the butter for 30 minutes, until semi-frozen. Dust a large grater with flour (to stop the butter sticking). Grate the butter into a large bowl. Rub in the flour and salt with your fingers. Add 4-5 tbs of cold water and bring it together to form a dough. Wrap it in cling film and chill for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 200°C (Gas 6).
Roll the pastry out on a floured work surface into a rectangle about 20 x 30cm.

Brush the surface of the pastry with the egg yolk and sprinkle over the smoked paprika. Sprinkle the cheese over in a thin layer, and press it in well with the flat of your hands. Fold the pastry in half and press down well to enclose the cheese totally.
Cut the pastry into 15 strips, each about 1cm wide. Hold the top of each strip and twist the bottom a few times to make a pastry spiral.
Place the cheese straws onto a baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes at the top of the oven. Cool on the tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
